description: Conversion of existing barn into 2 x 3-bed 5 person dwellings with associated parking and amenity space (Application for Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.
REASON
To comply with Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers 869/RDP/P04 Rev. C and 869/RDP/P05 Rev. A; and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON

To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and the London Plan (March 2021).

Any damage caused to the building in execution of the works, internally and externally, shall be made good to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority within six months of the works being completed. All materials shall match that of the original building.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
Unless specified on the approved drawings, the Local Planning Authority's agreement must be sought for the opening up of any part of the interior of the building.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of relevant works, the following details in relation to the inserted first floor, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. No part of the first-floor structure shall be supported by the existing timber frame.
(i) Detailed scaled drawing of the construction of first-floor structure and how it shall be structurally supported. The drawing shall be no more than 1:20 in scale.
(ii) Detailed scaled section of the junction between the first-floor structure and existing timber frame. The drawing shall be no more than 1:10 in scale.
Thereafter the development shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management

A detailed method statement, setting out the application of insulation to Barn 1, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the relevant part of the work is begun. The method statement shall clearly set out the different approaches applied to the walls and roof and take in account the original and existing timber frame. The statement shall also include detailed annotated scaled sections of each method of insulation to Barn 1, alongside product details of the materials to be used.
Thereafter the development shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2

Prior to commencement of relevant works, a full schedule of works including repairs to the existing barn structure shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Works shall be carried out in accordance to the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of relevant works, the product details and locations of all service pipe runs, extract vents/flues, and soil vent pipes and electricity and other meter boxes shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Works shall be carried out in accordance to the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of any works in relation to this consent, the existing building shall be recorded up to a Level 2 recording, in accordance with guidance set out in Historic England's Understanding Historic Buildings: A Guide to Good Recording Practice (May 2016). The record shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Copies shall also be deposited to the Greater London Historic Environment Record and the London Borough of Hillingdon's Museum and Archives Service.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Where existing external materials are required to be removed under the consented work, they shall be retained on site, securely stored and re-instated on the building in the same location.  Details of any new materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the relevant part of the work is begun. Details shall include product and manufacturer information. Works shall be carried out in accordance to the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
No part of the existing or original timber frame shall be altered, cut, removed or replaced without written authorisation by the Local Planning Authority.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
The original timber frame shall remain in exposed in the following locations as part of the consented conversion works.
- Roof trusses, including the collar
- Entrance/ threshing porch
- Rear (South West) elevation for its full height
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, details of the ground floor slab construction shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include a scaled section no more than 1:10 in scale and product details of materials.
Thereafter the works shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, product details of all external and internal windows and doors shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All windows shall be constructed of timber.
Thereafter the works shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, detailed scaled sections of the new external  windows, including the glazing at the apex of the gable ends to the north and south of barn 1 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The drawings shall be no more than 1:10 in scale.
Thereafter the works shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, a detailed drawing of the installation of the conservation rooflights alongside the existing timber frame and product details including manufacturer information shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The conservation roof lights shall be installed completely flush along the roof line or set just below the roof tiles.
Thereafter the works shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to installation of any rainwater goods, product details including manufacturer information shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All guttering and down pipes to Barn 1 shall be constructed of a cast metal with a black finish.
Thereafter the works shall be carried out and maintained in full accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the curtilage listed building, in accordance to Policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan (March 2021) and national guidance.

The applicant should note that this approval extends only to the works detailed as part of this application. In the event that the works cannot be implemented without a degree of alteration, the applicant is advised to contact the Local Planning Authority in order to ascertain whether further Consent might be required

During the works, if hidden features of interest are revealed they shall be retained in-situ. Works shall be halted in the relevant area of the building and the Local Planning Authority shall be notified in writing immediately. Failure to do so may result in unauthorised works being carried out and an offence being committed.
